section.title: No Plus Entries in Password Files
section.para: Removes any '+' characters from local identification and authentication (IA) repositories: passwd, shadow, and group files. passwd

The '+' character is used to include Network Information Service (NIS) maps into local IA mechanisms. If NIS is not used, then do not use the '+' character because it poses a security risk. NIS
NIS+

listitem.para: CC-8 - Controlled Use of Administrative Privileges
GEN001980 - The .rhosts, .shosts, hosts.equiv, shosts.equiv, /etc/passwd, /etc/shadow, and/or /etc/group files must not contain a plus (+) without defining entries for NIS+ netgroups.
